what-it-does: Checks for the use of global statements to update identifiers.
why-is-this-bad:
Pylint discourages the use of global variables as global mutable
state is a common source of bugs and confusing behavior.
example:
var = 1


def foo():
    global var  # [global-statement]
    var = 10
    print(var)


foo()
print(var)



Use instead:


var = 1


def foo():
    print(var)
    return 10


var = foo()
print(var)

example-split.example-before:
var = 1


def foo():
    global var  # [global-statement]
    var = 10
    print(var)


foo()
print(var)
